text:
I would like to build an Apache + Tomcat to build my personal web site.
However, after install it, I find that my machine is always crash
(BSOD!!). The installation procedure as follow:

1)Get Apache 1.3.9, install it
2)Get jakarta-tomcat.zip (3.1 build), unzip it and set the needed path
(JAVA_HOME and TOMCAT_HOME)
3)Get ApacheModuleJServ.dll     
4)Put the line: Include "I:\tomcat\conf\tomcat-apache.conf" and the end
of Apache server (i:\tomcat is my TOMCAT_HOME)
I haven't edit the setting in
http://jakarta.apache.org/tomcat/jakarta-tomcat/src/doc/tomcat-apache-howto.html,
because I find that I just need the default setting is ok.

Is here anything wrong with this config? Can you share your experience?
Do I need to install Apache 1.3.12? I am using Traditional Chinese
Windows, will it cause problem? Should I install mod_jk?
creator: dev@tomcat.apache.org
marc.saegesser@apropos.com
text:
If I is a network drive try moving Tomcat onto a local hard disk.  Applications 
(like Apache and Tomcat) can't cause BSoD crashes, this is the realm of drivers 
and system software.  Network drivers and video drivers are notoriously poorly 
written.
